### Why are you signing up for SkilledTradesBC Portal?

I want to be an Apprentice / I am an Apprentice I want to be an authorized staff of a sponsor / I am an authorized staff I want to register my organization as a new sponsor  __A sponsor is an individual or organization committed to supporting apprentices in getting on-the-job training opportunities, reporting an apprentices’ work-based training hours, ensuring they attend school, and progressing through their apprenticeship journey. Sponsors can take various forms such as employers, labor organizations, non-profit organizations, and more. In cases where a sponsor also employs an apprentice, they become an employer sponsor, a dual role where they provide employment and support for the progression and completion of apprenticeship. I want to become certified/I want to be a Trade Qualifier/I want to be an Uncertified Experienced Worker  __**Trade Qualifier**  
A Trade Qualifier is a person who is qualified to write the relevant B.C. Certificate of Qualification and/or Red Seal exam without completing an apprenticeship program. **Uncertified Experienced Worker**  
An Uncertified Experienced Worker is a person who plans to get off the tools within the next five years and wants to apply for a temporary authorization to work until then.  
  
To be qualified as an Uncertified Experienced Worker, an individual must have demonstrated to SkilledTradesBC’s satisfaction that they have at least 36,000 hours of work experience that meet the competencies included in the Skilled Trades Certification trade program profile. I want to register my organization as an employer in Skilled Trades Certification trades  __**This option is for those who employ workers in Skilled Trades Certification (STC) trades but do not sponsor them.**  
  
An employer is an individual or company that employs and pays a tradesperson for their work, while providing on-the-job training opportunities to develop knowledge and skills. In cases where an employer also takes on the responsibilities of a sponsor, they become an employer sponsor, a dual role where they provide employment and support for the progression and completion of apprenticeship.  
  
The Skilled Trades Certification trades are construction electrician, industrial electrician, powerline technician, refrigeration & air conditioning mechanic, gasfitter class A & B, steamfitter/pipefitter and sheet metal worker. Other

**Please note that you must be an employer in Skilled Trades Certification trades to create this account. If you are in a non-Skilled Trades Certification trade and want to sign up as a sponsor, please download and fill out the[Sponsor registration form](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/forms) on our website. Submit the form to our Customer Service team, who will review it and set you up on the Portal. **  
  
**You can expect confirmation of registration in about 10 days.**

### Contact Us for more information on signing up for SkilledTradesBC Portal

SkilledTradesBC Customer Service is open **Monday to Friday 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM**. Ask us about industry training and apprenticeship, including registration, examinations and certification. We’re here to help!
